Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2009 02:19AM mrsphilly wrote: Question.  Has anyone used ice packs or hot packs to help with the pain?  I have tried two different fairly stong pain meds and they don't help at all so I quit them.  My biggest problem is the tightness that seems to outline the area where the tissue was removed.  I am doing my exercises and not having any problem moving my arm, it just hurts with the slightest movement. I have small pillow I use under my arm which helps there but not on the front of my chest.  I have a Reach to Recovery volunteer, but she is on vacation until the 14th. Alice in SW MO
Posts.Title: underarm discomfort after surgery marin MarieK

Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2009 02:13AM mrsphilly wrote: I had surgery on 7/23 and drains removed on 7/29.  Yesterday after 3 days of increasing pain I saw the doctor and they had to aspirate a lot of fluid that had collected in the area.  The underarm was very uncomfortable, but since I am not a "small" person thought the rolls were just a part of me, turned out it was fluid collecting.  If the swelling moves as you touch it, it might be fluid colledcting be sure to contact your doctor's office. Alice in SW MO
Posts.Title: underarm discomfort after surgery marin MarieK

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2009 09:19AM mrsphilly wrote: I had to go back to the surgeon again today for more fluid build up.  Last Friday they drained 125 cc and today 60 cc.  Feels a lot better now.  He said that about 20% develop a fluid buildup after mx and as long as it is clear there isn't any problem.  He was hopefull this will be the last time.  If the lump squishes and flows to other areas then that is fluid.
Posts.Title: underarm discomfort after surgery marin MarieK
